comments: Claire Yan has really improved her teaching style since the first year I had her back in 2010. She\'s enthusiastic, helpful, and I feel like she\'s really looking out for the students. She bubbly and even tries to encourage class participation during tough morning lectures. If you had to choose her course, do it. Exams are fair and conceptual based.

Never really enthusiastic, but provides detailed notes, fair exams and outlines class expectations. If you attend class, take notes and are reasonably intelligent you will do fine. Mech Eng students will see her a lot so be sure to go to her office for all the Clarifications. Exam questions are closely related to assignments and lecture examples.
Very organized, lets you know exactly what she expects from you on tests, very good marker, pretty easy, not sure why she is rated so low
A lot of people seem to have a problem with Clair, but honestly she\'s pretty good. If you listen closely and follow along, she presents material very well. Very nice person too!
Bad prof. Needs a lesson in English because her communication is poor. Never answers questions properly and just confuses you more. She doesn\'t explain what she is teaching at all.

She is a strict prof., but knows her subject very well. Very helpful, has lot of office hours, so very approachable. Exams made by her are neither too hard, not too easy. Method of delivering the lectures is very good, explains everything with lot of examples. Overall not the best prof. but not that bad, as other people have mentioned here.
Hard to understand and an extremely hard marker. However, her notes can be quite helpful. Overall, she\'s not the best prof but she gets the point across.

You have to decide to not listen and copy notes only so you can look at things later, or you attempt to understand her gibberish which is extremely difficult and is only possible if you don\'t write notes. With this decision being the first one you\'ll make all semester this teacher is horrible!

RUN! She doesn\'t teach, she rambles on while being incomprehensible and then if you ask a question about what she\'s saying, she just repeats what she said and ignores your question essentially. Run while you still can
